question: Potassium and sodium shows similar chemical properties because they l. belong to the same group in the periodic table ll. Have equal number of electrons in their outermost shell lll. Both exist in the +1 oxidation state in their compound lV. Belong to the same period in the periodic table

Elements which belong to the same group in the periodic table are characterized by
options: difference of +1 in the oxidation numbers of successive members
present of the same number of outmost electrons in the respective atoms
difference of 14 atomic mass units between successive members
presence of the number of electron shells in the respective atoms
answer: present of the same number of outmost electrons in the respective atoms

Consider the reaction represented by the following equation: H2(aq) + I2(g) → 2HI(g) The number of effective collisions of molecules of the reactants decreases as
options: The volume of the system is increased
A catalyst is introduced into the system
answer: The volume of the system is increased

question: The rate of production of hydrogen gas from the reaction between Zinc granules and hydrochloric acid can be increased by
options: Using Zinc powder instead of Zinc granules
Using Zinc rod instead of Zinc granules
Carrying out the reaction at a higher pressure
answer: Using Zinc powder instead of Zinc granules
